# Reference

## Table of Contents

### Classes

* [`mailcatcher`](#mailcatcher): A class for mailcatching
* [`mailcatcher::install`](#mailcatcher--install): Installer for the mailcatcher
* [`mailcatcher::setruby`](#mailcatcher--setruby): Class to ensure the needed ruby version
* [`mailcatcher::systemdunit`](#mailcatcher--systemdunit): Class to manages the systemdunit file

## Classes

### <a name="mailcatcher"></a>`mailcatcher`

The software catches mail before are they send out and redirect to a UI.
These mails will never leave the host.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `mailcatcher` class:

* [`user`](#-mailcatcher--user)
* [`group`](#-mailcatcher--group)
* [`packages`](#-mailcatcher--packages)
* [`ruby_version`](#-mailcatcher--ruby_version)
* [`module_mngmt`](#-mailcatcher--module_mngmt)
* [`ensure_state`](#-mailcatcher--ensure_state)
* [`package_provider`](#-mailcatcher--package_provider)
* [`terminal_provider`](#-mailcatcher--terminal_provider)
* [`http_addr`](#-mailcatcher--http_addr)
* [`http_port`](#-mailcatcher--http_port)
* [`smtp_addr`](#-mailcatcher--smtp_addr)
* [`smtp_port`](#-mailcatcher--smtp_port)

##### <a name="-mailcatcher--user"></a>`user`

Data type: `String[1]`

user under which the service should run

##### <a name="-mailcatcher--group"></a>`group`

Data type: `String[1]`

group under which the service should run

##### <a name="-mailcatcher--packages"></a>`packages`

Data type: `Array[String]`

list of packages to be installed

##### <a name="-mailcatcher--ruby_version"></a>`ruby_version`

Data type: `String`

required ruby version

##### <a name="-mailcatcher--module_mngmt"></a>`module_mngmt`

Data type: `String`

dnfmodule: manage the ruby modules

##### <a name="-mailcatcher--ensure_state"></a>`ensure_state`

Data type: `String`

state of the packages (installed)

##### <a name="-mailcatcher--package_provider"></a>`package_provider`

Data type: `String`

provider to install ruby

##### <a name="-mailcatcher--terminal_provider"></a>`terminal_provider`

Data type: `String`

terminal to be use: shell

##### <a name="-mailcatcher--http_addr"></a>`http_addr`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::IP::Address]`

custom address where the app should listen
Default: 127.0.0.1

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-mailcatcher--http_port"></a>`http_port`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Port]`

custom port for the application
Default: 8010

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-mailcatcher--smtp_addr"></a>`smtp_addr`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::IP::Address]`

custom smtp address
Default: 127.0.0.1

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-mailcatcher--smtp_port"></a>`smtp_port`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Port]`

custom smtp port
Default: 2510

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="mailcatcher--install"></a>`mailcatcher::install`

Installer for the mailcatcher

### <a name="mailcatcher--setruby"></a>`mailcatcher::setruby`

Class to ensure the needed ruby version

### <a name="mailcatcher--systemdunit"></a>`mailcatcher::systemdunit`

Class to manages the systemdunit file

The following parameters are available in the `mailcatcher::systemdunit` class:

* [`desc`](#-mailcatcher--systemdunit--desc)
* [`doc`](#-mailcatcher--systemdunit--doc)
* [`after`](#-mailcatcher--systemdunit--after)
* [`type`](#-mailcatcher--systemdunit--type)
* [`restart`](#-mailcatcher--systemdunit--restart)
* [`wanted`](#-mailcatcher--systemdunit--wanted)
* [`restart_time`](#-mailcatcher--systemdunit--restart_time)

##### <a name="-mailcatcher--systemdunit--desc"></a>`desc`

Data type: `String`

Data type: `String`

Data type: `String`

Data type: `String`
